title: ESL TED Talk Activity - The Case for Optimism on Climate Change - Al Gore | Teaching Resources
text:
This Fantastic English Second or Foreign Language Teaching Resource is an ESL TED Talk Activity Worksheets (3 PDF Printable pages) on “The Case for Optimism on Climate Change - Al Gore” (speech by former U.S Vice President that emphasizes optimism on climate change, highlighting technological advancements, renewable energy progress, falling costs, and global action, arguing that humanity has both the solutions and moral responsibility to act decisively).
This ESL Teaching Resource can be ideal for post-TED Talks activities related to “The Case for Optimism on Climate Change - Al Gore”.
Ideal participants for this ESL Activity are English Foreign Students at Middle School and High School (7th - 12th Grade).
Newcomers or any English Language Learner can be more than suitable for this ESL Activity!
This Product can also be Great for English Second Language Centers or any ESL tutor around the world.
This ESL TED Talk Activity Worksheets on “The Case for Optimism on Climate Change - Al Gore” (speech by former U.S Vice President that emphasizes optimism on climate change, highlighting technological advancements, renewable energy progress, falling costs, and global action, arguing that humanity has both the solutions and moral responsibility to act decisively) can be great for Intermediate Advanced English as a Second Language Learners.
Within this ESL TED Talk Activity Worksheets on “The Case for Optimism on Climate Change - Al Gore” (speech by former U.S Vice President that emphasizes optimism on climate change, highlighting technological advancements, renewable energy progress, falling costs, and global action, arguing that humanity has both the solutions and moral responsibility to act decisively), there are included:
- 1 space for general information related to this TED Talk (when and where this TED talk was held + speaker + theme)
- 1 QR Code linked to the TED Talk’s Youtube Video
- 1 part dedicated to Pre-listening Discussion (Warm Up Activity)
- 1 part dedicated to New Vocabulary learnt
- 1 part dedicated to Listening Comprehension
- 1 TED Talk-related Speaking activity (questions)
- 3 writing activities (summary + personal opinion + creative response)
